channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ISIS ‘Ideology’ Is Linked to Australia Killings, and Trump Files New $10 Billion Lawsuit
item.description: Plus, how foreign patients are paying for U.S. organs.

item.title: Trump sues BBC for $10 billion over January 6 video editing
item.description: The broadcaster had apologized last month to Trump over the edit of the speech. But the publicly funded broadcaster rejected claims it had defamed him...

item.title: The silent, subtle mistakes that take executives out of the CEO race
item.description: In a CEO search, small moments can end a candidacy instantly.

item.title: Volkswagen to End Production at German Plant, a First in Company History
item.description: The auto giant stopped making cars at the plant in Dresden, which opened in 2001, as it faces weaker demand and steep U.S. tariffs.

item.title: Technological shifts are breeding a new type of CEO: Meet 25 rising execs inside the Fortune 500
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: A Push for More Organ Transplants Is Putting Donors at Risk
item.description: People across the United States have endured rushed or premature attempts to remove their organs. Some were gasping, crying or showing other signs of ...

item.title: This Week Is Pivotal for Ukraine, and for Europe’s Voice in Its Future
item.description: Often left out by the United States in peace negotiations, European countries are working to assert their leadership and bolster Ukraine with an ambit...

item.title: America’s $38 trillion national debt ‘exacerbates generational imbalances’ with Gen Z and Millennials paying the price, warns think tank
item.description: "Without significant policy changes to reduce debt growth, future generations will inherit a budget where significant resources are locked into servic...

item.title: Global selloff in stocks signals AI bubble may be ending in the healthiest way possible
item.description: Investors are selling off individual stocks of companies that seem to be overextended, but they are broadly bullish on stocks as a whole.

item.title: Live Updates: Sydney Gunmen Were Motivated by ISIS, Australia’s Leader Says
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said two gunmen who killed 15 people at a Jewish holiday celebration were motivated by the Islamic State.

item.title: Brigitte Macron, First Lady of France, Says Sorry for Slur Against Feminist Activists
item.description: In a short video, the French first lady said that she was “sorry if I have hurt women victims,” but she also noted that she should be allowed to behav...

item.title: The Untold Story of How Jeffrey Epstein Got Rich
item.description: For years, rumors swirled about where his wealth came from. A Times investigation reveals the truth of how a college dropout clawed his way to the pin...

item.title: As Israeli Settlements Get Bigger, Palestinian Hikes Grow Shorter
item.description: With Israelis rapidly building in the West Bank, Palestinian hikers are increasingly unable to walk across the land.

item.title: Heroic Bondi Beach Bystander’s Immigrant Background Is a Balm for Some Australians
item.description: Ahmed el Ahmed, a Muslim who arrived from Syria nearly 20 years ago, disarmed one of the suspected gunmen, who officials said were inspired by ISIS.
